item.title: Minimal Parking Spaces Available, 13th December
item.description:
Parking & Resident Impact Non-residents leaving vehicles for several days or even weeks without moving. Multiple commercial vans being parked long-term on the street. Residents regularly unable to park near their homes due to long-stay vehicles. Parking pressure expected to worsen as new Sydenham Hill developments fill up. Safety Concerns Large vans blocking visibility for children and families walking to/from school. Reduced visibility at junctions and driveways due to oversized vehicles. Street Misuse Road increasingly being used as a storage area for non-resident commercial vehicles. Vehicles staying beyond reasonable durations for residential parking. Current school-hours parking restrictions not preventing long-stay occupation. Request to the Council Investigate the issue as it is happening daily and worsening. Assess the street for resident-priority parking measures.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Thorpewood Avenue, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip if black rubbish sack by litter bin fronting Beckenham Public Hall, 13th December
item.description:
On the footway adjoining the black litter bin fronting Beckenham Public Hall, 4, Bromley Rd, Beckenham at 10.40pm on Friday 12/12/25 a tall, thin, black male smartly dressed in a beige suit and white shirt, flytipped a black rubbish sack. He may have been related to a car parked outside Ask Italian, next door. He crossed the road and entered St George's Rd.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Bromley Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves blocking pavement, 12th December
item.description:
The upper part of inverine road has not been swept of leaves in weeks everywhere else’s has and this road always gets missed. It looks awful. It is now slippy and you can’t tell where there is dogs mess please can you sweep this? Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Inverine Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Failed street light since beginning of December 2025., 12th December
item.description:
This is a "passageway" (Harringay Passage) between Burgoyne Road and Cavandish Road. A failed street lamp makes the footpath less safe and can attract ASB. during dark evenings and night-time.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harringay Passage, Harringay, Greater London
